Posts.Content: Aug 7, 2008 02:28PM Mysticalbabe21 wrote: UPDATE!!!!, ok so yesterday i went to see the surgeon who told me in his opinion the lump has the look of a fibroadenoma but just to be sure he did a core biopsy which was far more painless than i expected, he did a small incision close to the areola with the surgical blade then he injected me the anesthetic then came the thing he called a gun.lolol. it even sounded like a gun, only it came with a long ass needle when he used to remove tissue from the lump, so this huge needle was shot it with a 'pax' sound and all i felt was the jerk and this was done 6 times then it was over, so now i have to wait 3 weeks before there's a back up at the lab to find out what the lump really is but for sure he says it has to come out either waya because it's of it size, it's pressing on the existing tissue in my breast and causing a disturbance, ie. the nubness and the pain and the discharge so in three wks i'll know but strangely enough i'm not scared i'm actually excited.
Posts.Title: Huge lump on my mamogram Mysticalbabe21 smithlme

Posts.Content: Aug 4, 2008 05:11AM Mysticalbabe21 wrote: Thank u soo much for your responses to my post, it feels good talking to persons who actually know what ur going through, i have an appointment with a surgeon on wednesday, lord knows i can't wait till wednesday, i was also wondering which one was more effective, to get the biopsy done with the long needle or to have the lump surgically removed, this stuff is all soo real all of a sudden, one minute ur buying the breast cancer support stuff cause u love the color pink then the next minute ur buying the stuff cause u have a first hand look at what the hype is really about.

Posts.Content: Aug 4, 2008 05:29AM Mysticalbabe21 wrote: i think with all these different ailments affecting us today as a people it's gods way of bringing us all together and opening up our eyes to see the inside rather than the out, so color, race or whatever really doesn't make a different as this epidemic affects us all in the same way, so for me to choose a forum just for black woman cause i think they would more relate would be silly, i came to this site looking for answers as to what's going on with my body, i found a forum and i posted my story, i could live or die after this surgery i don't know and color or race was far from my mind believe me. so again thank u for ur responses
